radiographic_examinations.findings: A 9 x 5 x 8 mm hemangioma is again seen in the left hepatic lobe, unchanged from prior exam. The liver otherwise shows no new focal lesions or textural abnormality. Doppler assessment of the main portal vein shows patency and hepatopetal flow. There is no ascites. There is no evidence of intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary dilatation. The CBD measures 3 mm. The gallbladder is collapsed and contains stones. The pancreas is unremarkable. The spleen measures 10.9 cm and has a homogeneous echotexture. Limited views of the right kidney are unremarkable. The visualized portions of the aorta and IVC are normal in appearance.
